verbose_text: Levels of EPO-R and GYPA mRNA (mature erythroid markers) increased with the treatment with Ara-C but did not show any changes upon co-treatment with miR-125a ASO (results not shown), while the early marker CD71 was significantly higher in all ASO treated cells (XREF_FIG), confirming that miR-125a inhibition favors Ara-C-stimulated erythroid differentiation in K562 cells.
